timeline.bodyText: I am not aware about the context here, but why are we chaning module path, can we do it in a generic way ?
timeline.author: rednitish

replies.bodyText:
currently our routes are configured as

the route "/search" loads the Search component
the route "/product" loads the Product component
the route "/products" loads the  ProductListing component
the route "/git" loads the GitImport component
the route "/login" loads the Login component
Loads ModuleDisplay component if path has :data value
Because of the last condition, today we can load assembly details on module detail page. This route is not ideal if we want to have a separate assembly detail page. That's why i updated the route logic to allow assembly detail page to be loaded on its own.
replies.author: xdavidson

timeline.bodyText: the value is repeating within the context, can we use it through assigned variable directly ?

timeline.author: rednitish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -75,7 +76,15 @@ class Routes extends Component<IAppState> {
         exact: false,
         icon: null,
         label: '', // Empty because we are using the Brand component to render the text.
-        path: '/:data',
+        path: '/module/:data',
